def: Everyone who buys goods and services forms the economy
Individuals who buy gods and services from businesses
Describes the state of key factors within a country such as the level of goods and services produced and the number of jobs available
The cost of borrowing money or the reward for saving money expressed as a percentage
A flexible loan which businesses can use up to an agreed limit
The value of goods and services bought by consumers over a time period
Products whose sales are sensitive to changes in consumers incomes
